title: Sari, late 19th–early 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread
Technique: plain weave with areas of double-interlocked tapestry weave with narrow bands of extra weft-floats and complementary warp floats
description: Light reddish-brown sari with a wide border at each end and a narrow border on each side in silk and metallic thread. The end borders are patterned by ten flowering bushes or "butah" on a gold background. Two narrow floral vine borders with a gold background at top and bottom. Colors are dark blue, medium blue, red, pink, orange, and green.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sari, late 19th–early 20th century. Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread
Technique: plain weave with areas of double-interlocked tapestry weave with narrow bands of extra weft-floats and complementary warp floats. 1969-62-2.
